name: sfpwowerscripts-analyzewithpmd-task
friendlyName: Run a static analysis of apex classes with PMD
description: This task is used to run a static analysis of the apex classes and triggers using PMD,This task is part of SFPowerscripts, Please ensure Install SFDX Task is used before utilizing this task
helpMarkDown: Utilizes PMD 6.18.0 to run a static analysis and attaches the output to the build artifact
author: dxatscale@accenture.com

inputs.name: directory
inputs.label: Source directory that needs to be analyzed
inputs.helpMarkDown: The directory that is to be analzed using PMD, If omitted default project diretory as mentioned in sfdx-project.json will be used

inputs.name: ruleset
inputs.label: Select the ruleset to be used for analysis
inputs.helpMarkDown: Inbuilt is the default ruleset that comes with the task, If you choose custom, please provide the path to the ruleset

inputs.name: rulesetpath
inputs.label: Path to the ruleset
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the ruleset if you are utilizing your own ruleset

inputs.name: format
inputs.label: Format for the static analysis to be displayed in the console and written to the result file

inputs.name: outputPath
inputs.label: Output file
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file to which the output for static analysis will be written

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version of the pmd to be used
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version of PMD to be used for static analysis

inputs.name: isToBreakBuild
inputs.label: Report the build as failure if there is critical defects
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable this option if the build should be reported as failure if 1 or more critical defects are reported during the analysis

inputs.name: project_directory
inputs.label: Project Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The project directory should contain a sfdx-project.json for this command to succeed
